item.title: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）表示正在研究在美国交叉上市的问题。
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）周五表示，该公司正在研究将其股票在美国交叉上市的计划，同时也在泛欧交易所保留其股票。【原文：TotalEnergies said on Friday that it is studying plans to cross-list its shares in the United States, while also keeping its shares on the Euronext stock exchange.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物需求激增，礼来再投资 53 亿美元新建印第安纳州生产基地
item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly）周五表示，该公司已向印第安纳州黎巴嫩的新生产厂再投资 53 亿美元，是之前投资额的两倍多，因为该公司正努力满足对其减肥药和糖尿病药物不断飙升的需求。【原文：Eli Lilly said on Friday it has invested another $5.3 billion in its new Lebanon, Indiana manufacturing plant, more than doubling its previous investment, as it scrambles to meet soaring demand for its weight-loss and diabetes drugs.】

item.title: 美国对 Waymo 自动驾驶汽车的安全调查发现更多事故
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五表示，它又获悉了九起事故，这些事故引起了人们对 Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 自动驾驶汽车性能的担忧。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Friday it has learned of nine additional incidents that raise concerns about the performance of Alphabet's Waymo self-driving vehicles.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与 Capital One 终止信用卡协议
item.description: 沃尔玛（Walmart）与美国第一资本金融公司（Capital One Financial）周五表示，沃尔玛已终止与该公司的协议，后者曾是沃尔玛消费信用卡的独家发行商。【原文：Walmart has ended its agreement with Capital One Financial , which was the exclusive issuer of Walmart consumer credit cards, the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒指出未来基本利率可能上升的原因
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周五表示，在经过多年的下降之后，关键的基本利率有可能在未来上升，但现在说是否会发生还为时过早。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Friday it's possible that a key underlying interest rate may rise in the future after years of declines, but it's too soon to say if that will happen.】

item.title: 美国 4 月份核心资本货物订单和发货量反弹
item.description: 4 月份美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单反弹幅度超过预期，这些货物的出货量也有所增加，这表明企业在第二季度初的设备支出有所回升。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods rebounded more than expected in April and shipments of these goods also increased, suggesting a pick up in business spending on equipment early in the second quarter.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司批准尚布里亚特出任新首席执行官
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）称，其董事会周五批准了玛格达-尚布里亚（Magda Chambriard）担任公司新任首席执行官的提名。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras said its board of directors on Friday approved the nomination of Magda Chambriard as the company's new Chief Executive.】

item.title: 受降息预期影响，美国股票基金每周大量流入
item.description: 在截至5月22日的一周里，美国股票基金获得了大量资金流入，这主要是受到美国联邦储备委员会因通胀放缓迹象而可能降息的预期，以及企业盈利强劲增长带来的乐观情绪的推动。【原文：U.S. equity funds secured substantial inflows in the week ended May 22, buoyed by expectations that the U.S. Federal Reserve might cut interest rates due to signs of slowing inflation, alongside optimism from robust corporate earnings growth.】

item.title: 波音公司员工对产品安全和质量的担忧增加了六倍
item.description: 波音公司周五表示，在 2024 年的前两个月里，该公司员工提出的与产品和服务安全有关的问题比去年同期增加了六倍。【原文：Boeing saw a six-fold increase in submissions from its employees raising concerns related to the safety of products and services during the first two months of 2024, compared with the same period last year, the planemaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，一些大银行要求更多员工每周五天返回办公室工作
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四晚些时候报道，花旗集团、汇丰控股和巴克莱银行正在命令更多员工每周五天到公司办公室报到。【原文：Citigroup , HSBC Holdings and Barclays are ordering more staffers to report to company offices five days a week, Bloomberg News reported late on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国众议院委员会推进农业法案草案，民主党人支持率不高
item.description: 共和党领导的美国众议院农业委员会于周四深夜通过了其版本的 1.5 万亿美元农业支出法案，但民主党的投票却寥寥无几，延长了两党在关键的营养、农业和气候政策上的僵持。【原文：The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives Agriculture Committee passed its version of a $1.5 trillion farm spending bill late Thursday night with few Democratic votes, prolonging a standoff between the parties over key nutrition, agriculture, and climate policies.】

item.title: 德国财政部长表示，实施全球最低税率协议是德国的首要任务
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）周五表示，实施全球最低税率协议的第二支柱是德国的优先事项，在就第一支柱达成协议之前，不应讨论进一步的想法。【原文：The implementation of the second pillar of the global minimum tax deal is Germany's priority and further ideas should not be discussed until there is an agreement on the first pillar, German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said on Friday.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Lucid 将裁员 6
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 Lucid 集团周五表示，将裁员 6%，约 400 人。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Lucid Group said on Friday it would reduce workforce by 6%, or around 400 employees.】

item.title: 通胀忧虑打压华尔街后期货回升
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货上涨，在上一交易日收盘下跌后反弹，原因是有迹象表明通胀持续存在，在长周末到来之前重燃了对货币政策的谨慎态度。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Friday, rebounding after closing lower in the previous session on signs of persistent inflation that rekindled monetary policy caution ahead of a long weekend.】

item.title: 解说员：美国加快股票交割的预期
item.description: 美国市场将在 5 月 28 日（周二）迎来一场动荡，在美国证券交易委员会（SEC）于 2023 年 2 月通过一项新规则后，美国股票、公司市政债券和其他证券的结算时间将减半至一天，即 T+1。【原文：U.S. markets are set for an upheaval on Tuesday, May 28, when the settlement time for U.S. equities, corporate municipal bonds and other securities will be halved to one day, or T+1, following the adoption of a new Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) rule in February 2023.】

item.title: 美联储梅斯特：央行行长应承认在不那么确定的世界中存在盲点
item.description: 在为美联储工作和帮助领导美联储的近 40 年中，克利夫兰联储主席洛雷塔-梅斯特（Loretta Mester）是美国中央银行就经济和货币政策提供更详细、更丰富评论的革命的一部分。【原文：In nearly 40 years working for and helping lead the Federal Reserve, Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester was part of a revolution that saw the U.S. central bank offer ever more detailed and plentiful commentary on the economy and monetary policy.】

item.title: 受美国降息预期影响，全球股票基金每周资金流入强劲
item.description: 受通胀放缓的乐观情绪和美国联邦储备委员会下半年降息预期的推动，全球股票基金在截至5月22日的一周内获得了强劲的资金流入。【原文：Global equity funds secured robust inflows in the week ended May 22, driven by optimism over slowing inflation and expectations of U.S. Federal Reserve rate cuts in the latter half of the year.】

item.title: 美国债务负担不断加重，部分债券投资者在 11 月大选前感到恐慌
item.description: 在今年的总统大选之前，投资者认为巨额财政赤字看不到尽头，因此他们正准备迎接美国政府债务的大量发行，随着时间的推移，这可能会使预期的债券反弹相形见绌。【原文：Investors are bracing for a flood of U.S. government debt issuance that over time could dwarf an expected rally in bonds, as they see no end in sight for large fiscal deficits ahead of this year's presidential election.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储担忧压倒人工智能主题，黄金反弹
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 流亡中国商人 10 亿美元诈骗案周五在美国开审
item.description: 流亡海外的中国商人郭万里（Miles Guo）的欺诈案预计将于周五在曼哈顿开庭，检察官将发表开庭陈述，称郭万里通过一个欺诈性的商业帝国骗取了投资者和客户超过 10 亿美元。【原文：Exiled Chinese businessman Miles Guo's fraud trial is expected to kick off on Friday in Manhattan with an opening statement from prosecutors, who say he conned investors and customers out of more than $1 billion through a fraudulent business empire.】

item.title: 日本电产更正了过去的业绩，因为部分销售额被 "夸大 "了
item.description: 日本电机制造商日本电产株式会社周五将两年的营业利润下调了约 6700 万美元，原因是该公司一家子公司的部分销售额被 "虚报"。【原文：Japanese electric motor manufacturer Nidec Corp revised down two years of operating profit by about $67 million on Friday after determining that some sales were "recorded in an inflated manner" at a subsidiary.】

item.title: 在高呼和 K-pop 歌声中，三星工会举行罕见集会，要求公平工资
item.description: 周五，在 K-pop 表演和舞曲的背景下，2000 多名三星电子的工会工人聚集在首尔，举行了一场罕见的集会，要求这家韩国科技巨头支付公平的工资。【原文：Against a backdrop of K-pop performances and dance music, more than 2,000 unionised workers from Samsung Electronics gathered in Seoul on Friday, holding a rare rally to demand the South Korean technology giant pay fair wages.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，KKR 将无条件获得欧盟对意大利电信交易的反垄断许可
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，美国投资公司 KKR 在同意保留与意大利电信（TIM）竞争对手的商业协议后，有望获得无条件的欧盟反垄断许可，以收购该公司的固话网络。【原文：U.S. investment firm KKR is expected to gain unconditional EU antitrust clearance to buy Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed-line network after agreeing to keep commercial agreements with TIM rivals, people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道首席财务官称西门子可能将西门子能源股份转让给养老基金
item.description: 西门子集团财务总监告诉路透社，西门子股份公司可能会将其在西门子能源公司剩余的 17.1% 股份转让给集团的养老基金，以避免通过配售稀释公司股份的价值。【原文：Siemens AG will likely transfer its remaining 17.1% stake in Siemens Energy to the group's pension fund to avoid diluting the value of the company's shares via a placement, the group's finance chief told Reuters.】

item.title: 最后期限临近，盎格鲁铜资产争夺战考验必和必拓的决心
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American）的投资者要求必和必拓对整个公司提出更简单的收购要约或提供现金甜头，以达成可能成为矿业史上最大交易的协议，这将考验必和必拓为其投资组合增加更多铜矿的决心。【原文：BHP's resolve to add more copper to its portfolio will be tested by Anglo American investors' demands for a simpler offer for the whole company or a cash sweetener to clinch a deal that could become the biggest in mining history.】

item.title: 七国集团（G7）主席称全球跨国公司最低税率协议注定失败
item.description: 意大利经济部长吉安卡洛-乔盖蒂（Giancarlo Giorgetti）在周五开始的七国集团（G7）金融峰会前表示，有关全球跨国公司最低税的协议将无法按原计划在 6 月前敲定。【原文：An accord over a global minimum tax on multinationals will not be finalised by June as previously planned, Italy's Economy Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said ahead of a G7 finance summit starting on Friday.】

item.title: 空客为电动卡车配备客机驾驶舱，研究更安全的滑行方式
item.description: 空中客车公司正在展示一种不同寻常的车辆--一辆装有 A350 客机基本控制装置的卡车--该公司希望借此展示自动滑行将如何使机场更加安全，因为人们对接连发生的喷气式客机在地面相撞事件的担忧与日俱增。【原文：Airbus is showing off an unusual vehicle - a truck fitted with basic A350 airliner controls - that it hopes can demonstrate how automated taxiing will make airports safer as concern grows over a spate of jetliners colliding on the ground.】

item.title: 聚焦：竞争对手退出，捷克在线杂货商 Rohlik 加速德国扩张
item.description: 创始人兼首席执行官托马斯-库普尔（Tomas Cupr）告诉路透社，随着外国在线食品杂货配送竞争对手退出德国，总部位于捷克共和国的 Rohlik Group 正在欧洲最大的经济体加紧发展，并有望在未来 12 个月内实现收支平衡。【原文：As foreign online grocery delivery rivals exit Germany, Czech Republic-based Rohlik Group is ramping up in Europe's biggest economy and is on track to break even within the next 12 months, founder and chief executive Tomas Cupr told Reuters.】

item.title: 对冲基金看好亚洲市场，日本公司成为焦点
item.description: 在本周的一次对冲基金会议上，日本股市成为焦点，占据了亚洲顶级投资理念的大部分，资产经理们强调了日本公司为提高资本效率所做的努力，以及东京股市创纪录的上涨。【原文：Japanese stocks were in focus at a hedge fund conference this week, accounting for most of the top Asia investment ideas as asset managers highlighted Japan Inc's efforts to improve capital efficiency as well as the record run for Tokyo shares.】

item.title: 数据显示特斯拉削减上海的 Model Y 产量
item.description: 据行业数据和一位知情人士透露，自 3 月份以来，特斯拉上海工厂最畅销的 Model Y 电动汽车的产量已减少了两位数。【原文：Tesla has cut output of its best-selling Model Y electric car by a double-digit percentage number at its Shanghai plant since March, according to industry data and a source.】
